data.title: KS3 Geography (Environment and society) Revision
data.meta_description: Geographers need to know how to use and interpret maps and atlases. In order to be able to use these as a source of information, they need a range of skills
data.text:
Lines of latitudeImaginary lines around the Earth running parallel to the equator. These are measured in degrees north or south of the equator. and longitudeImaginary lines around the Earth running from the north to the south pole. These are measured in degrees east or west of the Greenwich or Prime Meridian. are used to locate places accurately on the Earth's surface.

Lines of longitude run from the top of the Earth to the bottom. They are not parallel as lines of latitude are - they meet at a point at the north and south poles and are called meridians.
